section.p: Each type of noise source has its own characteristic noise profile therefore has its own frequency spectrum that could have a different impact on radio performance. Scrambled data signals for high-speed interfaces (e.g. USB 3.0, DDR5, PCIE) are broadband, covering a wide frequency range and radio band in the GHz range. On the other hand, clock signals are highly periodic and have a relatively narrowband spectrum, which leads to the generation of harmonics. Unlike scrambled data, these harmonics are periodic and predictable.
